mapper.select: select l_roleid, c_rolename, c_isenable, c_roledesc from tuserrole order by l_roleid desc

select t.l_roleid, t.c_rolename, t.c_isenable, t.c_roledesc, x.usercount from tuserrole t left join (select count(1) as usercount, l_roleid from tuserrolerela group by l_roleid) x on t.l_roleid=x.l_roleid order by t.l_roleid desc

select l_roleid, c_rolename, c_roledesc from tuserrole where 1=2
or l_roleid= #{l_roleid}
or c_rolename like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{c_rolename}), '%')
order by l_roleid desc

select a.l_roleid, a.c_rolename, auth.c_authname, auth.c_authtype, t.l_roleauthid, a.c_roledesc, a.c_isenable, t.l_authid from tuserrole a left join tauthrolerela t on a.l_roleid = t.l_roleid left join tauthority auth on t.l_authid=auth.l_authid where a.l_roleid=#{roleId,jdbcType=INTEGER}

select a.l_roleid, a.c_rolename, auth.c_authname, auth.c_authtype, t.l_roleauthid, a.c_roledesc, a.c_isenable from tuserrole a left join tauthrolerela t on a.l_roleid = t.l_roleid left join tauthority auth on t.l_authid=auth.l_authid where a.c_rolename like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{name}), '%')
mapper.update: update tuserrole set c_roledesc= #{c_roledesc}, c_rolename= #{c_rolename},c_isenable=#{c_isenable} where l_roleid=#{l_roleid}
